summary: This document consists of email exchanges from August 11-12, 2019, between law enforcement and a medical examiner regarding the coordination of evidence and interviews related to the death of Jeffrey Epstein. It discusses the delivery of evidence, including the clothing Epstein was wearing when found, and the scheduling of interviews with those who discovered the body.

persons.name: Courtney
persons.context: Appears as a recipient in the email header, but no further role or action is described in the visible text.

events.title: Evidence delivery coordination
events.description: An individual is on their way to deliver evidence, including the clothing the decedent (Epstein) was wearing when found, to the offices of the recipient.

events.title: Interview coordination
events.description: The sender is coordinating interviews, specifically with those who discovered the body and what actions they took, with results anticipated by the end of the day.

locations: 520 First Avenue, New York, NY 10016 (Office of the Chief Medical Examiner)
keyFacts: The emails are dated August 11-12, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
The correspondence involves coordination between law enforcement and the New York City Medical Examiner's Office (OCME) regarding the Epstein death investigation.
Specific evidence mentioned includes the clothing Epstein was wearing when he was found.
Interviews were being scheduled with individuals who discovered the body.
The email headers and signatures contain redacted or partial names, limiting the identification of specific individuals involved.
